hints.content:
We can relate division to arrays:
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}$
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}=\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}$
$\color{green}21\color{black} \div \color{purple}7$ equals $\color{green}21\color{black}$ total dots split into rows of $\color{purple}7$.
This array has $\color{green}21\color{black}$ total dots split into rows of $\color{purple}7$.   [[image 0]]
This image represents $21 \div 7$:   [[image 0]]

There are $\color{green}42\color{black}$ carrots with $\color{purple}7$ carrots in each row.  [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3457cc31a2de482ddd6c13a564ab296b3e337be5.svg]] How can we find out how many rows of carrots there are?

We can find how many rows of carrots there are by dividing:$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the rows}\color{black}$So, $\color{green}42}\div\color{purple}7\color{black}$
The following expression will tell us how many rows of carrots there are:- $\color{green}42\color{black}\div\color{purple}7$

question.content: There are $42$ total carrots split into rows of $7$ carrots.  [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b4eedc16a81518e9b3399a9b82af3d0f5ada169.svg]]  **Which expression will tell us how many rows of carrots there are?**

hints.content:
We can relate division to arrays:
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}$
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}=\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}$
There are $\color{blue}4$ rows with $\color{purple}10\color{black}$ dots in each row.  [[image 0]] There are $\color{green}40\color{black}$ total dots.

$\color{green}40\color{black}\text{ total dots}\div ~\color{purple}10\color{black}\text{ dots in each row}= \color{blue}4\text{ rows}$
$\color{green}40\color{black}\text{ total dots}\div \color{blue}4\text{ rows}  ~=\color{purple}10\color{black}\text{ dots in each row}$

The following expressions represent the array:- $\color{green}40\color{black}\div\color{purple}10\color{black}$
- $\color{green}40}\div\color{blue}4$

question.content: **Which expressions could represent the array shown below?** [[image 0]]

hints.content: There are $\color{green}25\color{black}$ books in $\color{blue}5$ equal rows.  [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4da0e35432982cdbafc93b77781b115d508ca8ac.svg]] How can we find out how many books are in each row?
We can find how many books are in each row by dividing:$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}\color{black}$So, $\color{green}25}\div\color{blue}5\color{black}$
The following expression will tell us how many books are in each row:- $\color{green}25\color{black}\div\color{blue}5$

question.content: There are $5$ equal rows of books. There are $25$ total books.  [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b6b98282acb82b9d8c58642fcea595fa46ad7b60.svg]]  **Which expression will tell us how many books are in each row?**

We can relate division to arrays:

There are $\color{blue}5$ rows with $\color{purple}6$ dots in each row.  [[image 0]] There are $\color{green}30\color{black}$ total dots.

$\color{green}30\color{black}\text{ total dots}\div ~\color{purple}6\text{ dots in each row}= \color{blue}5\text{ rows}$

The following expressions represent the array:- $\color{green}30\color{black}\div\color{purple}6$

hints.content: There are $\color{green}20\color{black}$ boxes in $\color{blue}4$ equal rows.  [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/51eafe193502a2b098331835dd9afbe0744f26de.svg]] How can we find out how many boxes are in each row?
We can find how many boxes are in each row by dividing:$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}\color{black}$So, $\color{green}20}\div\color{blue}4\color{black}$
The following expression will tell us how many boxes are in each row:- $\color{green}20\color{black}\div\color{blue}4$

The following expression will tell us how many groups of people there are:- $\color{green}20\color{black}\div\color{purple}2$
